unit_learning_outcomes.description: Design and communicate a digital strategy that is aligned to an organisation and is optimal for delivering growth and profitability.
Undertake internal and external strategic analyses to assess an organisation’s competitiveness in the digital era.
Identify basic mechanisms and logics of digital business models and examine the key resources and capabilities of digital transformation in their implementation.
Identify and discuss political, social, economic and technological developments driving the imperative to develop digital business models.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: A focus lies on group work, guest lectures, pre-class readings and pre-recorded material on business ecosystems and platform-based business models to ensure that students are sufficiently equipped for detailed discussions as well as interactive in-class activities and discussions to develop advanced digital business models during the unit.

assessments.description: This group assignment will require students to design a digital business model for an allocated organisation.

Students will be required to submit a 2,000-word report to describe the necessary transformational activities the allocated organisation needs to implement in order to realise the designed business model.

data.unit_offering_text:
Term 2, Intensive attendance, North Ryde*
Term 2, Special circumstances
Term 4, Weekday attendance, North Ryde*
Term 4, Special circumstances

* This unit offering is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.
data.description: Digitisation, IoT, robotics and artificial intelligence are key concerns for executives and business leaders. These technologies, along with other developments, create a VUCA world where existing business models are made obsolete. Organisations need to update their strategies to create a fit between their value creation, value capture and value delivery activities (i.e. business models) and their competitive environment. To do so, it is essential to understand the potential and limitations of these digital technologies and other developments, in the context of an organisation’s business model and competitive strategy. Through real-world case studies, this unit presents, discusses and analyses actionable insights into how digital technologies have affected an organisation’s business model, digital infrastructure and strategy, and is used by organisations to create a competitive advantage.
data.title: Digital Strategy for Business
